name: Michelle
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
3 weeks ago
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
We came for a wedding and this was the perfect place to gather extended family together. The living room with the adjoining dining room/sitting room was perfect for a large gathering and the babies loved the train table and all the toys. My adult children liked how convenient it was to get to downtown Concord with the coffee shops and restaurants.
One thing was not obvious to me, but maybe with an older house it should have been. The stairs are very, very steep so it may not be appropriate for an older guest or young child. The one bedroom and bathroom upstairs should be assigned to the young and nimble. We had those as part of our guests, so no problem for us. The downstairs bathroom is on the other side of the house from the two downstairs bedrooms which might be an issue for those getting up often at night. The location of this delightful house far outweighed these issues, but just thought I would mention them in case the house will not work for others.

It is in a great location that allowed us to walk most places and was even a couple of blocks from an EV charger for our car. With the supplied portable heaters everyone was very comfortable despite the cold rainy days we encountered. All information provided was clear and the couple of questions we had during our stay were answered promptly. We will be visiting Concord occasionally and would definitely enjoy staying here again.

review_text: It's a very cool old house a few blocks from downtown Concord. House had lots of space, was well equipped and was very comfortable for our group. We enjoyed the convenience to downtown. I was also very happy that Adam has realistic expectations of renter's responsibilities for cleaning upon departure and reasonable cleaning fees. Too many rentals these days expect a full detailing of the house on top of excessive cleaning fees. We did have a minor issue upon arrival but Adam was quick to help solve the issue which was very much appreciated. Would definitely stay at this property again!

name: Yan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
November 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This is a wonderful, old house. It's clearly been maintained with love and care, we felt right at home when we got there. Lots of room for the whole family, terrific dining/kitchen area with a door to the back porch. Kitchen is well-equipped if you need to cook. The bedrooms are cozy and comfortable. In addition to the porch, there's also a patio with mosquito netting, for sitting outside. Adam was very responsive to all communications and included clear instructions throughout the house on how everything worked. We stayed for three days, and the whole family had a wonderful time! The location is right next to the State Capitol and the Library, so you're minutes from downtown Concord. White Park is a five minute walk, and we can't recommend it highly enough. This is a great location to experience historic Concord, definitely check it out!

·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Impeccably clean rooms. Super comfortable queen-size bed. The little room with table, refrig, tea offerings, etc. was a nice unexpected extra. The bathroom is very small, especially the sink area that was somewhat awkward for to use, but all was serviceable and spotless/polished. I was not crazy about the taking off shoes part of this that I did not know ahead of time; maybe I missed it. Main reason is that the entrance to the steep stairs is tiny and there was not enough room for two people and two suitcases to be there while taking off shoes. I also do not enjoy walking around in socks. Would have brought house shoes had I known. The very steep stairs are not conducive to older people. The price was fair, but the hotel down the street would have been about the same. I purposely did not bother Josh while there, but from the speed of his reply when I asked a question before booking, I can say that he would be extremely helpful if needed. Rooms all perfectly cared for.

review_text: Josh's Airbnb in Concord, New Hampshire was an excellent value for the price. The location is great, in a quiet neighborhood but still close to all the major attractions in the city. Communication with Josh was easy and prompt, he was always available to answer any questions I had and provide helpful recommendations. The cleanliness of the space was top-notch, it was evident that a lot of effort was put into making sure the space was spotless and comfortable. We highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking for value, and in a great location with a host who is respectful and provides clear communication along with attention to cleanliness. It a pleasure meet you, Josh and thank for everything.

review_text: Host was very communicative and responsive. Suite has a very spacious bedroom and bathroom and loved the access to a washer/dryer. Also enjoyed the reading room nook which had great light. Comfy couch in the living room. Provided dish ware, toaster oven, microwave, hotel size fridge with freezer, and full sink in the laundry room to wash dishes. The parking lot entrance is off of Liberty Street, though address for GPS is on School Street; just something to be aware of when parking. Parking lot is spacious and no need to park on a street which is great. Only a 3-minute ride from good breakfast options and just 4-5 minutes ride to downtown/Main Street. There are a fair amount of stairs to navigate to get inside to the room; anyone with mobility issues might find them steep, but not an issue otherwise. Overall a great deal for the location and size of the rental!

Rating, 5 stars

October 2022
,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
If you love and appreciate beautiful Victorian homes, then this is the place for you! My husband and I stayed at “the castle” for 3 nights on our first trip to New Hampshire. It’s more like staying in your own personal apartment then at a air bnb!
The space looks exactly as shown in the photos. Ashley and her husband do a great job of adding lots of little details and touches (down to the popcorn and max & cheese!). The bed is really comfortable and the washer/dryer was great to have on hand.
The location is VERY easy to find via gps and there is a parking lot for guests that made it easy to come and go. My husband and I had a great time using it as our base for the weekend.
Concord is a adorable town. The bnb is about a 15 minute walk to the Main Street. Tucker’s, a great spot for breakfast, is about a 20 minute walk through the neighborhood with lots of Victorian houses to view along the way.
We spoke individually with both Ashley and her husband. They are extremely nice and lovely people that wanted to make sure we had the best experience while staying at “the castle”.
The house was very quiet and it was great to come back to a relaxing place after exploring all day.
I highly recommend anyone stay here! We hope to come back next fall and cannot wait to be at “the castle” again :)

name: Timothy
rating_info:
Rating, 1 star
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The pics of this airbnb are great and make you think you ate getting this great old castle location, but in reality it's just an old junky house, you can'/t tell it's a castle unless above in a drone. It's very hard to find by GPS, and then the hallways were dark and they use old keys to open the locks. The front door was never locked by other tenants (probably because the doors are so old it's hard to do so unless pulling on the door while turning the key.
So while I could have paid half the price for a much better located airbnb and much more modern, I got suckered into this by the pics and the supposed "superhost"
Let me tell you the communication was horrible from the moment I arrived and ultimately ended with them kicking me out (apparently because a guest overheard me yelling at "myself" when I misplaced some of my items (and thought they were stolen because I was in such a dump in such bad neighborhood)
I know people will go to this place because of the pics and the supposed reputation of the renters. All I can say is AVOID THIS PLACE like the plague and hope you don't end up in the same situation I was. This place is so bad I may never use airbnb again, nevermind simply avoiding the concord "bs castle" forever!!!
I'm just so happy to be home and away from the situation I ended up in because I made the mistake of renting this dump.

review_text: I was searching online for a homey and quiet environment for my daughter, who was scheduled to take her anxiety-induced bar exam in Concord. Every detail in Concord Castle was designed to make us feel relaxed, comfortable and pampered--post-shower robes, mini fridge, coffee station, tasteful and cozy decor. The king bed was a dream, the rocking chair in the turret was a sanctuary. The temperature was pleasant with AC and ceiling fans, and we appreciated the use of the washer/dryer. The location was short walking distance (6 minutes) to beautiful White Park and a short 5 minute drive to Main St. And lastly, Ashley was very responsive to our questions, and even allowed us an extended check-out which I really appreciated. We were so grateful for the peaceful and quiet aura Ashley's Castle provided--everything about it was a 5*!

Very spacious place as there is a bed room with a king bed, a separate sitting area w/small fridge (new) with a freezer, and a Kreuig, w/a variety of coffee and teas (but no decaf selections), also small toaster oven. Ashley was very easy to communicate with and responsive. This is on the second floor, w/no elevator. Nice parking on site. I would not have any reservations recommending this place for a stay for single or couple to stay.

I rushed from coastal maine to Concord when my 97 year old dad was taken to the ER. I was up all night. I explained my situation and inquired about an early check in. The space was vacant that night so I got in early. I was able to nap before bouncing back to the hospital.
I felt at home and comfortable every time I was able to take some down time.
Super duper hosts!

name: Christie
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
We really enjoyed our stay here. It was a nice setup for a family with young kids, close to our in-laws and to downtown.
Pros:
- Nice kitchen with necessities (gas stove, dishwasher, basic pots/dishes). Ample dish towels and cleaning supplies.
- Kitchen basics: sugar, flour, coffee filters (no coffee), tea, salt and pepper
- Dining table was nice
- Bathrooms well equipped with shampoo and body wash, shower had a removable shower head
- Linens smelled nice
- Nicely furnished with stylish but simple decor, soft rugs, smart tv, child-friendly layout
- Nice and safe neighborhood
Things to make us return without doubt:
- The beds were too uncomfortable for us (trampoline-like and noisy). This was the biggest drawback for us but admit we're light/picky sleepers and most people are not.
- There was lots of light which we loved; blackout curtains in bedrooms would be a huge plus for kids/other time zones.
Overall, a very nice place close to downtown Concord. Thanks for sharing your home!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
We stayed here during the week of Christmas while visiting family. The hosts are very communicative and friendly and answered all of our questions leading up to the trip.
Check-in was flexible and easy! The house was ready a few minutes earlier than expected, so we didn’t even have to wait after arriving into Concord from the airport.
My husband and I were traveling with our toddler, so we only used two of the bedrooms. We wished the bedrooms had been more cozy and comfortable, but we were able to borrow some extra blankets from family to make it feel more like home.
Proximity to downtown and White Park were a HUGE plus while traveling with a toddler. So was the bathtub upstairs and the on-site washer and dryer! 😍
Thankful to the hosts for their hospitality over the holidays.

The space is really big and everything felt clean and welcoming. It was a super walkable area with a great little downtown and a park nearby for walking my dog. Jan and Mark were friendly, responsive, and very welcoming. And pet-friendly which is something I really appreciated since it can be hard to find places that allow pets. Mark was readily available when we had questions, and took good care of us. The location in Concord is excellent - easy access to downtown, Fort Eddy Road stores, and White Park. We enjoyed walking in the neighborhoods surrounding this park - lovely architecture. Thank you for a fantastic month!

If you are looking for a place to stay that is close to downtown Concord do not miss out on this amazing opportunity!

The New Hampshire Historical Society and the State Library are even closer, on Park St. My daughter and I spent 2 nights here, then I chose to book the next night, to extend my stay. Communication with the host was easy; I was happy that this added reservation could be arranged, quickly and smoothly.

We appreciated the close proximity to Main Street shops and restaurants (easy 10 minute walk), and the location was easy driving distance to NHTI, Hooksett, and chain shopping (Walmart, Target, etc).

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Nice place, Nice location if you want to be just minutes from main street and the shops and restaurants in Concord, and it’s a short drive out to hiking and recreational activities. I would have given five stars except that the first night the central heating wasn’t working ( it’s an old system with steam radiators). Communication on resolving the issue initially wasn’t great in terms of the attitude of the initial host who responded (there is more than one person helping manage the unit). But eventually appropriate apologies were made and the heat was fixed the next day. Was just a thermostat problem. Fortunately they did have space heaters in the apartment and also the second smaller bedroom has its own electric baseboard heat, so we were fine.

name: Amber
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: Easy to find, nice quiet neighborhood. The apartment was clean. It’s a house with a shared staircase. We stayed downstairs (another locking keypad on our door) and someone else was staying in the upstairs apartment. The place was clean and had what we needed for a quick overnight. My friend didn’t love the mattress in the room with the double bed, but the queen bed was fine in our room. We got in kind of late and the apartment was rather cold. My friend is hot blooded so she loved that! I used a space heater for my bedroom and it warmed up quickly and nicely. (My husband couldn’t figure out how to turn on the radiator-there were instructions- but we thought perhaps they weren’t officially “on“ yet.) Space heaters were perfect. It was about an hour from Boston. Not sure about Concord itself as a city with things to do, as we continued on our way early the next morning and didn’t hang out. But it was a perfect overnight and I would definitely recommend if you’re trying to get out of the city!

name: Anthony
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I can't really say anything bad about the place. There is climate control in every single room, the water pressure is great, and it is very clean. The beds are comfortable, and there is plenty of space for even 5 people. The location is great, it's quite literally a two-minute walk to an amazing Pizza joint called Checkmate Pizza that serves delicious food, and it can be delivered to you as well. There is an absolutely beautiful park also within a 10-minute walk as well as a laundromat. It's in very close proximity to Ft. Eddy Plaza, which hosts many different places to shop and eat. Above all else is the fact that the amenities offered really make the place feel like home, with cookware, dishes, utensils, a dishwasher, an oven, a microwave, a toaster oven, and a variety of seasonings make it easy to prep your own meals if you are into doing that sort of thing on vacation. We were lucky enough to have a loaf of bread in the cupboard, as well as peanut butter. It saved us from having forgotten to buy breakfast food the day before, and we got to stay in during the morning hours. If you need to do any sort of homework or want to use spare time to do some work before going home, there is either a comfortable study in the bedroom to do this, or a comfortable seat at the bar. The WiFi is very fast, and there is a nice smart TV in the living room to watch movies on. It's also very quiet, not many cars or any sort of aircraft flying by. If you have trouble sleeping with noise, you won't have any difficulty here. I don't typically write reviews on many things, but I really enjoyed the stay, I'm sure you would to!

review_text: McKayne's AirBnb surpassed my high expectations. Tuckers, the top-rated place in Concord for full breakfasts, was only 1.3 miles from his home. I instantly relaxed in my room and slept better than usual. The bed was extremely comfortable, and no loud traffic in the morning. Everything was pristine. His excellent online guide was provided upon reservation. I messaged excerpts to my phone from my home to ensure I could access wifi easily. All was handled perfectly with no in-person contact required. Finally, McKayne thoughtfully permitted me to use a hallway armchair after checkout, so I could attend my online class. Each room has individual controls for the ceiling fan, the portable air-conditioner, and there were more than ample outlets for recharging phones, tablets, laptops, etc.

The hosts were very thorough with communication with regards to an incoming snow storm and off street parking in one of the city's garages. The car stayed nice and dry, and the walk gave me an opportunityto discover what a beautiful and safe neighborhood this house is located in. Located a couple blocks from the State Capitol Building, expect to see many historical and well maintained homes in the area. Again worth noting is how quiet the space was affording a great place to sleep between twelve hour shifts of work. Excellent value as well and will look forward to future stays!

review_text: We had a great stay at this AirBnb. It was as described. The queen bed is comfortable and the room was clean. There was a shared bathroom with other rooms, but we knew this and it was clean and well maintained. There is also shared a shared keurig and toaster available, as well as a few games. No issues and a great affordable stay.

name: Mindy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Enjoyed my stay here. Exactly as described. Check-in was a breeze! Posted guidance with tips were a huge help. Room was huge and bed was comfy. Little extras like coffee pods to use in the Keurig, granola bars, and Red Bull in the fridge were a sweet welcome surprise. There was even a little white-noise machine in the room if needed. Window AC kept the room nice and cool. Shared bathroom was also huge and I didn’t have any problems with it being available when I needed it. Street parking was perfect as there was always space available on the cross street during the day which was steps away from the home, and space available right in front during the evening. Quiet neighborhood within walking distance or a very short drive to downtown Concord and conveniently located to major highways. Will stay again in the future!

name: Tiffany
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
June 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Easy check in and good instructions. The room was as described. Unfortunately, as you open the main door, you are hit with an extremely strong animal urine odor which is coming from one of the downstairs tenants. The smell follows you up the stairs and there are even in the shared bathroom. Luckily, my room escaped the smell which is why I stayed the night. The room and bathroom are clean and well stocked. I am not sure how many people use the upstairs bathroom but 3 people upstairs and at least 1 downstairs. Which meant that someone is always waiting to use it...
The biggest problem is that when I brought this to the attention of the host, they merely said: "apologies". Zero customer service, no shock at the conditions and no reassurance that they would fix this issue. I stayed one night in a pinch but unless this health hazard is taken care of, I would not stay again.

review_text: This was a surprising little hidden gem of a stay! The space was just as described in the listing; sparkling clean, in a peaceful, quiet rural neighborhood setting. The home is beautiful and the space was perfect for my 34 year old son from Los Angeles visiting NH. He couldn’t stay with us (for health reasons) and this stay gave him a whole new outlook about the area on so many levels. I wanted to extend the stay but sadly it was booked. Highly recommend!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Mackayne’s hospitality began from my initial round of correspondence when I booked two rooms a couple of months before our stay. The advertising represents the accommodations colorfully and accurately, and the location truly is central to Concord’s best offerings, whether by foot or car. The rooms and shared space are private, quiet, and replete with just enough conveniences to start or end the day (mini-fridge, microwave, air conditioning unit, closet, and flat screen TV in each room; toaster, kettle, coffee maker in hall. Free storm rage closet, enormous, immaculate shared bathroom with great shower pressure. Key code access is coming convenient, leading to the private entrance of rooms, which are up a high, decoratively carpeted stairwell.

name: Curtis
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
June 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Great Airbnb - excellent location (10 mins walk of downtown, New Hampshire State House, the shops, bars, cafes and restaurants of Main Street, etc.), literally around the corner from NH 4th Highway, but in a quiet, calm, safe neighborhood. Free parking around the corner helps, too. Excellent value for the location, and the amentities are set up like a real hotel (little snacks, water bottles, a mini-fridge, desk, bed, complete towel set and fan all make for a real hospitality experience). The hosts were extremely responsive; my last night, I added an extra night (literally the 11th hour) at the last minute at 11:00pm, only to wake up, first thing in the morning at 7:00am, to see that it was approved. The host always responded immediately, sometimes within 5-30 minutes of me writing. The pinpads that secure the front door and the guest room are easy to use and uncomplicated, and the WiFi is fast and easy to connect to. Really just a very solid Airbnb all around, one of the better ones I've stayed at overall. I highly reccommend. I hope when I return for my next training I can stay here again. I cannot reccommend enough. If you are staying in Concord (or even Manchester and want a nicer, quieter, safer place to stay), check this out - it's super convienient, well priced, well located and well worth it. Check this place out - you won't regret it.

review_text:
The room had everything we needed and more for an overnight trip to Concord and at a great price that made me feel lucky and taken care of.
Bed and room were comfortable and quiet and felt like we had privacy even with a shared bathroom (it was clean and available when we needed it.) Can tell the house is historic in the way it’s built which is really cool and also felt it was modernized to fit our current needs, a good balance. Great location near downtown but on a quiet street.
Hosts were super responsive and accommodating while booking and we didn’t need anything during the stay (they thought of it all from extra emergency toiletries if we forgot items to instructions for temp adjustments to cards and games) but I’m confident they would’ve been helpful if we’d needed help while there. Would love to stay again or at one of the hosts’ other places!

review_text: Absolutely BEAUTIFUL Airbnb. We crashed our car right in front of their house checking in and they were 200% communicative, helpful and responsible. review_text: Brigid was wonderful. We communicated the the app before we got to her house. We were on the later side of checking in. Brigid came outside to greet us. she showed us around. We felt right at home. The next day Mom went to had surgery, when I came back Brigid asked how mom was doing. Which felt nice and she listened as I talked. She let me check out later then 10am on my last morning. We talked a little about quilting and I got to see wall hanging in our room and a quit she had been working on. She lives in a beautiful area. The house has a beautiful, loved homey feel. The bedroom has the same feel, you could bring you computer and work at the little desk and look out at the orchard or sit in the comfy chair and read by the fire. The house is wonderful. For me Brigid and her dog are what made my stay The best it could be. Thank you Brigid for all that you do.

review_text:
Title: A Hidden Gem in Concord
Rating: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
My recent stay at Brigid's Airbnb property was nothing short of amazing! From the moment I walked in, I was captivated by the charm and warmth of this hidden gem. Dakota did his greeting and a welcome hug. He is a really cute and friendly dog.
Brigid is an outstanding host who effortlessly combines hospitality with a genuine passion for making guests feel at home. They were accommodating, friendly, and quick to offer recommendations for local experiences that truly enhanced my trip.
She has put a lot of thought into every detail, making the space not only stylish but also incredibly functional. My stay at Brigid's place exceeded my expectations in every way. I wholeheartedly recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking for a memorable and comfortable stay in the heart of the city.
Thank you, Brigid, for your hospitality and for sharing your wonderful space with travelers like me!

Brigid was very nice and warm, and she is also a very interesting person who has a lot of stories and experiences that we really enjoy to hear. And her dog - Dakota was so cheerful and friendly.
The neighborhood was safe with most people around are senior citizens. The house is also next to an apple farm, which is a great place to visit.
We feel a little bit regretful that we cannot stay longer. We would definitely book Brigid's house again if we have the chances to visit New Hampshire again.

review_text:
What a gem! I was photographing a wedding at the Barn at Bull Meadow and the rehearsal dinner was at The Concord Hotel. This cottage was 3 minutes to the hotel and 10 minutes to the venue, so the location is perfection! The cottage is cozy, tastefully decorated, stocked kitchen and great details like k-cups, water bottles, snacks and even necessities like salt, pepper and olive oil. The king size bed is more comfortable that many 5* hotels I've stayed at, and the sheets were AMAZING! I had to find that brand and buy them for my own bed!
I spent the morning after the wedding editing photos in the beautiful living room sipping my morning coffee. It really felt like home.
I would totally stay again here. Loved it!

Surprisingly the immediate neighborhood was slightly iffy- as in, I didn’t feel unsafe in general but I don’t think I’d walk it alone at night. The renters had some really nice touches, such as a personalized note and snacks! Overall a great rental, perfect for a ski weekend with restaurant options close-by. Not sure there is much else to do in the area.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Rick and Sarah's place was charming and so well equipped. Two lovely bedrooms and an excellent bathroom with walk-in shower. Downstairs was a half bath, sitting room, fully equipped kitchen and an adorable back porch, all beautifully decorated. It was the perfect size for two couples. The location is ideal too, right in the middle of Concord near restaurants and shops and it is very easy to tour around New Hampshire from this location. We were there for a wedding. My aunts had never stayed in a rental and they absolutely loved it. The parking is very specific and there is space for two cars that must be parked back to back against the cottage as there is apartment parking surrounding it. We royally screwed this up but eventually got the parking right. The cottage was a little difficult to find but Rick and Sarah communicated well and sent a picture of its location. Thank you for sharing your lovely place with my family.

Overall, highly recommended and would return the next time we head to New Hampshire for a ski trip.

As others have mentioned, the stairs up to the apartment are steep and the treads are somewhat narrow. We were aware of this so it wasn't a problem. We would happily stay at Catherine's again.

Sweet hideaway blocks from downtown-great location.
Private off-street parking was helpful.
The space is private and felt like a European hideaway apartment.
Thoughtful touches are everywhere.
Spacious for the two of us.
The only hitch for us was one of the ceiling angles at the entrance-husband is 6'2 and forgot to duck under one of the angles and ouch. He only did that once.
The majority of the space has high ceilings, so not a big issue.
The stairs are a bit narrow and steep and with big luggage, you just need to take it slow.
This is a gem of a space and we will definitely stay again when visiting Concord.
Thank you!

review_text: The addresses on the block are not matched on each side, making finding the house a little difficult. Fortunately, a friendly neighbor was out and was able to help us find where we were going. Parking directions were a bit unclear with a photo but once asked to clarify, the parking was good. The apartment was clean and had good amenities. Private entrance with keypad for entry. The bed was very comfortable! Only negatives were the fridge could have used a better cleaning (glass above the crispers had something underneath it) and there were only 4 hangers in the closet and no dresser for clothing. The only other thing worth a mention was that the door at the top of the stairs does not lock which we found a bit odd as the homeowners could enter the downstairs entry from their side (NOT that they did!) Overall, we enjoyed our 3 day stay and the beautiful neighborhood it was located in. Thanks for the hospitality!

,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
What didn’t work well for us is probably that my daughter is disabled and I am 78 years old plus the fact that we had two small dogs. So the issue was that the stairs are extremely steep, glossy wooden ones and the depth is very slim. There is a railing on only one side of the stairs. The dogs were not happy campers and I ended up having to carry them up and down most of the time. I appreciate finding a decent place to book that allows us to bring the dogs, but I did not anticipate how hard it would be to stay in an older home with these type of stairs.
Everything is well kept and should work for younger and more mobile, agile folks. My daughter and I both have physical aches and pains and so sleeping on very soft foam mattresses isn’t the best option for our bodies.
It was a very quiet neighborhood with great access to a lovely downtown! We ended up staying here both going to Maine and on our return trip. Great host and super clean apartment.

name: Roberta
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This was our third stop on a 25 day roadtrip through New England, and the location was perfect.
We were touring the Law School, visiting the government/capitol buildings, and attending Market Days so it was an easy walk to everything downtown.
The whole space is on 2nd floor up some really steep steps with low ceilings so be aware. The stairs split the space with the master and kitchen on one side and living room, dining room and bathroom on the other. So biggest issue was that flow is a little interrupted.
The space was nice but there were little to no amenities (especially kitchen cookware). But since we didnt cook while there, it wasnt a problem.
Bathroom was only minor issue. No fan so have to leave window open when showering. It was really humid while there so apartment felt damp all the time.
And FYI, bring your own paper products (not TP) incl kleenex.
Overall it fit our needs, location was biggest draw, and the price sealed the deal.
We will stay again if in area.

We will definitely stay here every time we visit Concord.

review_text: Catherine is a host extraordinaire. I felt as tho I was communicating with a long time friend thru all of my messaging regarding processes, procedures and questions regarding airbnb arrangements. The apartment is outstanding and as I told Catherine, the apartment reminds me of what I envision a 5 star New York City loft would look like. The space is so welcoming, cozy, expertly decorated and has all the amenities one could possibly need. I can envision staying for an extended period of time because of the space amenities. The apartment is within walking distance from beautiful downtown Concord (my birthplace by the way) and is centrally located just a few miles from Route 93, Route 89 and NH Routes 3 and 4. Catherine provides a comprehensive resource book that lists all of the local and geographic highlights of the area. I have to add another star to the 5 star assessment and a ++ to this beautiful spot. I truly hope to be able to stay with Catherine again!
